bio.dateDescription: After graduating from the theatrical department of the Belarusian State Academy of Arts, specializing in 'puppet theater actor', he joined the troupe of the State Puppet Theater of the Republic of Belarus.
Director of the State Puppet Theater of the Republic of Belarus.
He graduated from the theater department of the Belarusian State Academy of Arts with a specialization in 'puppet theater directing'.
Nominee for the Russian National Theater Award «Golden Mask» (performance «Oedipus», 2012).
Winner of the III National Award of the Republic of Belarus «For the best direction of children's performances».

Art director of the Perm Puppet Theater. The play «Thick Notebook» by A. Christoph, staged by Alexander Yanushkevich at the Perm Puppet Theater, won the Russian national theatrical award «Golden Mask» in the nomination «The Best Puppet Theater» in 2016 year.
Since 2017 - the main director of the Brest Regional Puppet Theater.

works.title: «Oedipus» Puppet Theater «Gulliver», Kurgan, and the Creative Association «KultProekt», Moscow
«Garden», Puppet Theater of the Republic of Karelia, Petrozavodsk

bio.dateDescription: Fedor Ivanovich Shmakov was born in Petrograd

Entered the Leningrad Central Theater School (now St. Petersburg State Academy of Theatrical Art), which he graduated in 1939 (workshop of V.V. Merkuryev) and was accepted into the troupe of the State Russian Drama Theater of the Byelorussian SSR in Mogilev (now National Academic Drama Theater named after M. Gorky).

The theater toured in Bialystok when the war began. At the same time F. Shmakov ended up in Vitebsk, where he moved to the 2nd Belarusian State Theater (now the National Academic Drama Theater named after Yakub Kolas), on which more than 200 roles, and since the 60s and put the performances as a director.
Worked in a front-line theater brigade.
He died in Vitebsk at the age of 93. He was buried at the Mazurinsky cemetery in Vitebsk.

works.title: «Seventeen Moments of Spring» Y.Semyonov and V.Tokarev
